refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: int SSL_CTX_config(SSL_CTX *ctx, const char *name); int SSL_config(SSL *s, const char *name);

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: The functions SSL_CTX_config() and SSL_config() configure an SSL_CTX or SSL structure using the configuration name.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: By calling SSL_CTX_config() or SSL_config() an application can perform many complex tasks based on the contents of the configuration file: greatly simplifying application configuration code. A degree of future proofing can also be achieved: an application can support configuration features in newer versions of OpenSSL automatically.
A configuration file must have been previously loaded, for example using CONF_modules_load_file(). See config 3 for details of the configuration file syntax.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: SSL_CTX_config() and SSL_config() return 1 for success or 0 if an error occurred.

refsection.title: EXAMPLE
refsection.para: If the file "config.cnf" contains the following:
refsection.screen:
testapp = test_sect
[test_sect] # list of confuration modules
ssl_conf = ssl_sect
[ssl_sect]
server = server_section
[server_section]
RSA.Certificate = server-rsa.pem ECDSA.Certificate = server-ecdsa.pem Ciphers = ALL:!RC4
refsection.para: In this example two certificates and the cipher list are configured without the need for any additional application code.

refsection.title: HISTORY
refsection.para: SSL_CTX_config() and SSL_config() were first added to OpenSSL 1.1.0
